body: This is a rather nasty problem, as frequently changing the system proxy with different ports will break the desktop application, which will have to be restarted.
I would be fine with removing the internal caching.

Mabye you should try to add the `__internal_proxy_sys_no_cache` feature?
like this:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/16b75518-b4c5-4c54-914c-3fe0cc770cf6)
I would not recommend using that feature, because we provide no stability for it. It could be renamed or removed completely in a patch.

> Mabye you should try to add the `__internal_proxy_sys_no_cache` feature? like this: ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/73207840/374308137-16b75518-b4c5-4c54-914c-3fe0cc770cf6.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..wyYR7zdOTN3pO9dHhdvhZmGwfd6wcmQKlSyLhJYS_OY)

Yes, this worked

> I would not recommend using that feature, because we provide no stability for it. It could be renamed or removed completely in a patch.

Ah, no wonder I couldn't find anything in the documentation when I encountered this problem with reqwest before, this feature I found by reading the source code.
But if I want to solve this System Proxy caching issue now, what is the right way to do if not use this feature?
I would approve a PR that removes that code, including that Cargo feature, if you'd like to submit one.

> > I would not recommend using that feature, because we provide no stability for it. It could be renamed or removed completely in a patch.
> 
> Ah, no wonder I couldn't find anything in the documentation when I encountered this problem with reqwest before, this feature I found by reading the source code. But if I want to solve this System Proxy caching issue now, what is the right way to do if not use this feature?

I honestly don't understand why system proxies are cached globally, it is logical that when creating a new client the current state and parameters of the system proxy should be taken into account.

> I would approve a PR that removes that code, including that Cargo feature, if you'd like to submit one.

I would like to give this a try. 
Just to confirm, the PR you want would be to completely remove the `__internal_proxy_sys_no_cache` feature and all related caching logic for system proxies, so that every time a new Client is created, it always reflects the current system proxy settings. Is that correct?

issue.title: feat: remove feature `__internal_proxy_sys_no_cache`

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
Completely remove the `__internal_proxy_sys_no_cache` feature and all related caching logic for system proxies.
Now, every time a new Client is created, it always use the current system proxy settings.

The reason for upgrading `proc-macro2` from 1.0.62 to 1.0.87 is that the author has yanked version 1.0.62.

fix this issue #2441
